newsitem.title: UK: Mirror Group remains confident on prospects.
newsitem.headline: Mirror Group remains confident on prospects.

text.p: Newspaper publisher Mirror Group Plc had a "positive" first quarter and remains confident of a "satisfactory" year, chairman Sir Robert Clark told the company's annual meeting on Thursday.

"As far as current trading is concerned, the first two months of the year started well. In the run up to the general election advertising revenue, as expected, was subdued but forward bookings are encouraging," Clark told shareholders.
"Overall the group has had a positive first quarter and, barring unforeseen circumstances, the board remains confident of a satisfactory outcome to the year," he added.
The group, whose flagship Mirror title is Britain's second-best selling tabloid, reported 1996 pre-tax profit of 82.2 million stg, excluding exceptional items.
